alert.note: Alert for Chaves County Plains; Eddy Plains; Sacramento Foothills and Guadalupe Mountains (New Mexico) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Midland-Odessa (Western Texas and Southeastern New Mexico)
info.headline: Fire Weather Watch issued March 08 at 1:28PM MST until March 09 at 6:00PM MST by NWS Midland-Odessa
info.description: ...FIRE WEATHER WATCH IN EFFECT FROM WEDNESDAY AFTERNOON THROUGH WEDNESDAY EVENING FOR VERY HIGH FIRE DANGER FOR CHAVEZ, EDDY, AND CULBERSON PLAINS AS WELL AS SACRAMENTO, GUADALUPE, AND DELAWARE MOUNTAINS... * AFFECTED AREA...Sacramento Foothills and Guadalupe Mountains, Chaves Plains, Eddy Plains, Guadalupe Mountains Above 7000 Feet, Guadalupe and Delaware Mountains, Van Horn and Highway 54 Corridor and Eastern Culberson County. * TIMING...Wednesday afternoon * WINDS...West to southwest 20 to 30 mph with gusts up to 40 mph. * RELATIVE HUMIDITY...7 to 10 percent. * RFTI...5 to 7 or critical. * IMPACTS...Any fires that start may quickly spread. Outdoor burning is discouraged.
info.instruction: A Fire Weather Watch means that critical fire weather conditions are forecast to occur. Listen for later forecasts and possible Red Flag Warnings.

area.areaDesc: Chaves County Plains; Eddy Plains; Sacramento Foothills and Guadalupe Mountains
